titleStmt.title: A true and certaine relation of sundry great machinations and plots of divers Iesuites, priests, and other papists in severall parts of this kingdome against the proceedings of the Honourable the High Court of Parliament. And for the bringing of superstition and popery into this kingdome. Together with the coppy of a bull sent by the pope to Father William Stillington, provinciall of the English Jesuites, promising in it plenary indulgence to all those that should assist the papists cause; that is, full remission of their fines. Published by one that hath knowne all their plots, and by him discovered for the benefit of this common-wealth.
titleStmt.author: One that hath knowne all their plots, and by him discovered for the benefit of this common-wealth.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
